data.title: cocos compile -p mac fails with #include "SimpleAudioEngine.h"
data.body:
I needed to add

```
                "$(SRCROOT)/../cocos2d/cocos/audio/include/"
```

to HEADER_SEARCH_PATHS in proj.ios_mac/*.xcodeproj/project.pbxproj to get it working.

I see that this path is included in CMakeLists.txt in the project root directory.

It fails with empty cpp  project. The NDK_TOOLCHAIN_VERSION should be 4.9. Here is the relevant error log:

NDK build mode: debug
Parse NDK version from file /Users/Monika/Library/Android/ndk-r11b/RELEASE.TXT failed.

data.title: spine should support normal blend mode
data.body:
设置混合模式时，应该支持 normal，否则使用 _blendFunc 里面的混合模式，渲染有可能发生错误

测试动画：
[aitiwen.zip](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/189123/aitiwen.zip)

原先表现：（右边多了一个光点，没有隐藏起来）
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1503156/14039193/d0cb4474-f294-11e5-9fde-c97268dcd49f.png)

正确表现：（光点使用 src_alpha 混合后，就会变透明）
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1503156/14039182/b5da1dac-f294-11e5-9849-1c965a2d62e8.png)

Run the js-test, got the same result, no external link loaded.

data.title: Win10 UWP and Windows 8.1 fixes for v3.11
data.body:
This pull request updates the Windows 10 UWP and Windows 8.1 Universal project files with the changes needed to support v3.11.

This pull request fixes issue https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/15307.

Please note that WebSockets is broken for Windows 8.1 Phone. This will be fixed in another PR.

This pull request also fixes changes to include paths introduced by pull request https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/15281

data.title: Compile errors with APP_CPPFLAGS := -std=c++14 and APP_STL := c++_static on Android
data.body:
With APP_CPPFLAGS := -std=c++14 with APP_STL := c++_static in Application.mk for x86 Android build, I got the following errors.

`Library/Android/sdk/ndk-bundle/sources/cxx-stl/llvm-libc++/libcxx/include/tuple:290:102: error: invalid initialization of reference of type 'cocos2d::AsyncTaskPool::ThreadTasks::ThreadTasks()::<lambda()>&' from expression of type 'const cocos2d::AsyncTaskPool::ThreadTasks::ThreadTasks()::<lambda()>'
     _LIBCPP_INLINE_VISIBILITY _LIBCPP_CONSTEXPR_AFTER_CXX11       _Hp& get()       _NOEXCEPT {return value;}
                                                                                                      ^`

With -std=c++11, c++_static seems just fine.

data.title: Can't compile with NDK r11 for Android
data.body: With NDK 11.1.2683735 (r11) which comes with Android Studio 2, building a project by "cocos compile" with --app-abi x86 fails by make errors that wrongly assumes it's toolchain 4.8 (4.9 is correct) and tries to find Android/sdk/ndk-bundle/toolchains/x86-4.8/prebuilt/darwin-x86_64/bin/x86-g++.

data.title: cocos2dx-js v3.6 scrollview 里面加了一个 sclippingnode 裁剪的node，滑出显示区域还是显示。
data.body: 项目是cocos2dx-js v3.6版本， 在scrollview 里面 addchild 一个 clippingNode裁剪出得node，滑动scrollview的时候 这个裁剪的node显示有问题..！ 我知道最新版本的cocos 是解决的这个问题，但是我们项目不能换新引擎。 我想问 主要修改了哪些地方... @zilongshanren

data.title: update third party lib version
cocos2d-x-3.10 JS compiled version (.jsc) leaks on iPad.
data.body:
Hi,

Simple JS project with compiled files (jsc) and empty scheduleUpdate function leaks.
It leaks about 100K every 15 seconds.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run Cocos.app. Create new JS project with "Precompiled Library".
2. Open Terminal. change dir to the root of your new project where there are 'src' and 'res' folders.
3. Compile cocos sources: "cocos jscompile -s script -d lib/script".
4. Compile the projects sources: "cocos jscompile -s src -d lib/src"
5. Open the project from Cocos.app in Xcode.
6. Exclude "JS Common\script" and "Resources\src" from targets.
7. Add new group. Add "script" and "src" from "lib" folder to new group. Make sure "Create folder reference" is selected. Click Add.
8. Run the app on your device.
9. Open Debug navigator and check the Memory during one minute.
   --> Here the app must not leak. Stop the app.
10. Open app.js and change HelloWorldScene:

```
var HelloWorldScene = cc.Scene.extend({
    update:function(dt) {},
    onEnter:function () {
        this._super();
        var layer = new HelloWorldLayer();
        this.addChild(layer);
        this.scheduleUpdate();
    }
});
```
1. Run command from step 4 again to recompile changes.
2. Open Xcode. Run the app. Check the memory.
   --> Here the app must leak.

Regards,
Valery.

data.title: Allow inherit form platform fileutils
data.body:
The doc for FileUtils::setDelegate() says:

```
 * You can inherit from platform dependent implementation of FileUtils, such as FileUtilsAndroid,
 * and use this function to set delegate, then FileUtils will invoke delegate's implementation.
 * For example, your resources are encrypted, so you need to decrypt it after reading data from
 * resources, then you can implement all getXXX functions, and engine will invoke your own getXX
 * functions when reading data of resources.
```

But the constructor of  FileUtilsLinux, FileUtilsWin32 and FileUtilsWinRT are private.

So make these constructors protected which allows inherit from them.
